title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the Short Title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Art Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges as defined in section 2(a)(4). The term "tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions" is defined in section 390(2) of the Tribally Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. - SEC. 3 - Land grant status for tribally controlled community colleges and tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions. Land grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, shall be considered land-grant colleges. The applicability of related provisions includes any provision of any Act. Provisions of any Act of Congress relating to the operation or assistance to land-grant colleges in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern Mariana Islands shall apply to the land-grant colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of appropriations: In lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions. The Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, authorizes appropriations of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts. Amounts appropriated under this section are considered granted to these colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to them. The Act of July 2, 1862 authorizes appropriations for tribal colleges and institutions for agriculture and mechanic arts, subject to the provisions applicable to them. The "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" may be cited as the short title. The definition is provided in Section 2. The term "1994 Institutions" in this Act refers to specific colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, Lac Courte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, and Standing Rock College. The list of tribal colleges includes Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Any provision of Congress related to land-grant colleges applies to 1994 Institutions, with some exceptions. In lieu of extending provisions to 1994 Institutions under the Act of July 2, 1862, $23,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for these colleges. Amounts granted are subject to specific provisions. Amounts granted to 1994 Institutions are subject to specific provisions applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land scrip. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated annually for their purposes. The funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process developed by the Secretary. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated annually for their purposes. Funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process developed by the Secretary, with no matching requirement for funds made available pursuant to subsection (b)(3). SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. Subsections are also redesignated in section 4. For fiscal years 1995 through 1999, $1,700,000 is authorized for grants to 1994 Institutions for research facilities in agriculture and sciences. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
